notes: ECS requires electrical power from ATA-24 (3 kW peak). Power interface must be defined in ICDs.

ECS thermal control subsystem (BLOCK-40 physics domain) requires heat rejection capacity (5 kW). Intra-ATA coupling between operational systems (BLOCK-10) and thermal physics subsystem (BLOCK-40). Critical for mission success.
ECS environmental data must be displayed and recorded via ATA-31 systems.
Critical interface with life support gas distribution (ATA-35). Safety-critical coupling.
ECS control interfaces with vehicle compute platform (ATA-42) for autonomous control modes.
ECS telemetry and command via vehicle data networks (ATA-46).
Condensate removal and humidity control interface with water/waste system (ATA-38).
ECS must coordinate with fire protection systems (ATA-26) for safety.
ECS provides health status to Central Maintenance System (ATA-45).
ECS control interfaces must be cyber-hardened to prevent unauthorized access/manipulation.
ECS operational constraints must be integrated into parking/mooring/storage procedures.
ECS servicing (filters replacement fluids) must be defined in ATA-12 servicing procedures.
ECS must undergo integrated system testing per ATA-111 requirements.
ECS must pass space qualification testing (thermal cycling vacuum) per ATA-110.

required_evidence: Certification test results and compliance reports
notes: ECS must meet certification requirements for human-rated space transport.

decision_or_uncertainty: ECS power quality envelope and peak loads not allocated; risk of non-compliant operation under transients
notes: Requires ICD hooks to ATA24; baseline approval gate at LC03.

decision_or_uncertainty: Thermal interface bounds (heat rejection/absorption) not quantified; may violate platform thermal constraints
notes: Thermal constraints must be traceable from architecture → analysis → test plan.

decision_or_uncertainty: Air quality/smoke detection interface not specified; risk to hazard closure and alerting pipeline
notes: Couples to fire protection and safety evidence; may require DEC on thresholds and response timing.

decision_or_uncertainty: Alerting/indications for ECS thresholds not allocated; risk of non-compliant crew awareness
notes: Interface must be captured in ICD index; becomes hard if safety case requires explicit annunciations.

decision_or_uncertainty: Atmospheric control loop stability margins unknown across occupancy and failure modes
notes: Verification matrix must show objective→MoC→evidence; UQ/margins policy referenced if applicable.

decision_or_uncertainty: Heat rejection model assumptions may be invalid; risk of test plan based on wrong envelope
notes: Require runlogs + config manifests to make evidence reproducible; impacts TRR readiness.

decision_or_uncertainty: Data logging and parameter provenance not defined; weak auditability and digital twin ingestion risk
notes: If ECS telemetry is used for twin/ops decisions coupling becomes hard and requires CY/CERT interface.

decision_or_uncertainty: Maintainability constraints not translated into service intervals; risk to ops/MRO readiness and sustainment cost
notes: Promote to hard coupling if dispatch/turnaround constraints are mandated by program ops.

decision_or_uncertainty: Consumables/filters/material selection not mapped to circularity KPIs; risk to ESG claims and LC09/LC14 linkage
notes: Becomes hard if DPP/ESG claims are asserted for this subsystem.

decision_or_uncertainty: Test environment qualification and calibration chain not defined; evidence may be rejected
notes: For LC06 gate evidence acceptability requires environment + calibration trace (S-axis K04/K11 equivalents).

decision_or_uncertainty: CO₂ capture added to satisfy REQ-ECS-ATM-005 introduces bidirectional power interface and load envelope
notes: Power support mode requires defined charge/discharge envelopes
column24: and shedding behavior. CEGT is accountable; SE produces ICD details; CM baselines the interface and forbids relaxing requirements without change control.

decision_or_uncertainty: CO₂ capture/regeneration + energy module increase heat rejection envelope and thermal coupling
notes: Heat rejection must be quantified to avoid trading CO₂ control for thermal non-compliance. PHM produces thermal envelope; CM gates baseline; CEGT remains accountable for sustainability and loop integrity.

decision_or_uncertainty: Claim boundary: power support only requires auditable energy balance and LC06 verification mapping
notes: CERT needs explicit evidence that module is storage/management (not energy source) and that requirements are verifiable. CERT must accept evidence that the loop is closed and energy is stored/managed; no thrust and no mass ejection.

decision_or_uncertainty: CO₂ storage/pressure/isolation hazards and failure response must be bounded and verified
required_evidence: Hazard analysis + FMEA/FMECA + safety requirements trace
notes: Safety evidence produced by SAF but SIGNOFF remains STK_CERT per constraints.
